      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">
        Notes
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
       <div class="mw-references-wrap">
        <ol class="references">
         <li id="cite_note-a-1">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-a_1-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           In the recognized minority languages and the most spoken
           <a href="/wiki/Minority_languages_of_Croatia" title="Minority languages of Croatia">
            minority languages of Croatia
           </a>
           :
          </span>
          <dl>
           <dd>
            <ul>
             <li>
              <span class="reference-text">
               <a href="/wiki/Czech_language" title="Czech language">
                Czech
               </a>
               :
               <i>
                <span lang="cs">
                 Chorvatská republika
                </span>
               </i>
              </span>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/German_language" title="German language">
               German
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="de">
                Republik Kroatien
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_language" title="Hungarian language">
               Hungarian
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="hu">
                Horvát Köztársaság
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Italian_language" title="Italian language">
               Italian
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="it">
                Repubblica di Croazia
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">
               French
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="fr">
                République de Croatie
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Rusyn_language" title="Rusyn language">
               Rusyn
              </a>
              :
              <span lang="rue">
               Републіка Хорватія
              </span>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Serbian_language" title="Serbian language">
               Serbian
              </a>
              :
              <span lang="sr">
               Република Хрватска
              </span>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Slovak_language" title="Slovak language">
               Slovak
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="sk">
                Chorvátska republika
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Slovene_language" title="Slovene language">
               Slovene
              </a>
              :
              <i>
               <span lang="sl">
                Republika Hrvaška
               </span>
              </i>
             </li>
             <li>
              <a href="/wiki/Ukrainian_language" title="Ukrainian language">
               Ukrainian
              </a>
              :
              <span lang="uk">
               Респу́бліка Хорва́тія
              </span>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </dd>
          </dl>
         </li>
        </ol>

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="References">
        References
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="reflist columns references-column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em; list-style-type: decimal;">
       <ol class="references">
        <li id="cite_note-Census2011-nationality-2">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          ^
          <a href="#cite_ref-Census2011-nationality_2-0">
           <sup>
            <i>
             <b>
              a
             </b>
            </i>
           </sup>

        <li id="cite_note-Margetić-30">

          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Margetić_30-0">
            ^
           </a>

         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-56">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>

          </a>

        <li id="cite_note-57">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-57">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation book">

          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=European+Journal+of+International+Law&amp;rft.atitle=Recognition+of+States%3A+The+Collapse+of+Yugoslavia+and+the+Soviet+Union&amp;rft.volume=4&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=36-65&amp;rft.date=1993&amp;rft.au=Roland+Rich&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ejil.org%2Farticle.php%3Farticle%3D1207%26issue%3D67&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACroatia">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>

         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           Drago Pilsel (5 May 2011).
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.tportal.hr/vijesti/svijet/126015/Vatikan-nije-medu-prvima-priznao-Hrvatsku.html" rel="nofollow">
            "S kojim državama nemamo diplomatske odnose?"
           </a>
           [Which countries do we have no diplomatic relations with?] (in Croatian). t-portal
           <span class="reference-accessdate">
            . Retrieved
            <span class="nowrap">
             24 September
            </span>
            2011
           </span>
           .
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=S+kojim+dr%C5%BEavama+nemamo+diplomatske+odnose%3F&amp;rft.pub=t-portal&amp;rft.date=2011-05-05&amp;rft.au=Drago+Pilsel&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tportal.hr%2Fvijesti%2Fsvijet%2F126015%2FVatikan-nije-medu-prvima-priznao-Hrvatsku.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACroatia">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>

        <li id="cite_note-Croatian_Foreign_Policy:_From_State_Building_to_the_Regional_Power-112">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Croatian_Foreign_Policy:_From_State_Building_to_the_Regional_Power_112-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          Vukadinović R. (1996)
          <a class="external text" href="https://hrcak.srce.hr/file/155701" rel="nofollow">
           Croatian Foreign Policy: From State Building to the Regional Power
          </a>
          .
          <i>
           Politička misao
          </i>
          ,
          <b>
           13
          </b>
          (5): 148—165. - "
          <i>
           From almost empty handed people that have opted for creation of their state, back in 1990, through the painful process of state building in war conditions, liberation of the country and moving towards a normal life, Croatian foreign policy has considerably helped to cross the road from fighting for independent state to the situation where Croatia is nowadays being considered as a regional power in South-Eastern Europe.
          </i>
          "
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-Central_Europe_Top_500:_An_era_of_digital_transformation-113">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Central_Europe_Top_500:_An_era_of_digital_transformation_113-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <a class="external text" href="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/hu/Documents/about-deloitte/HU-CETop-500-finalreport-2016.pdf" rel="nofollow">
           Central Europe Top 500: An era of digital transformation
          </a>
          (2016) - Croatian conglomerate Agrokor is the largest enterprise in the modern Balkans.
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-Croatia:_an_Overview_of_its_History,_Culture_and_Science-114">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Croatia:_an_Overview_of_its_History,_Culture_and_Science_114-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          D. Zubrinic,
          <i>
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.croatianhistory.net/etf/etfss.html" rel="nofollow">
            Croatia: an Overview of its History, Culture and Science
           </a>
          </i>
          (2006) - Apart from its languishment under Yugoslav rule, Croatia has been a leading contributor to Western culture. The Croatian people have developed the necktie, the Mohorovičić discontinuity, and Glagolitic scripts.
         </span>
        </li>
        <li id="cite_note-Was_Nikola_Tesla_a_Serbian?_or,_the_Origin_of_Nikola_Tesla-115">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Was_Nikola_Tesla_a_Serbian?_or,_the_Origin_of_Nikola_Tesla_115-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          R. Rreci,
          <i>
           <a class="external text" href="http://xpo6.com/was-nikola-tesla-a-serbian-or-the-origin-of-nikola-tesla/" rel="nofollow">
            Was Nikola Tesla a Serbian? or, the Origin of Nikola Tesla
           </a>
          </i>
          (2015) - The famous Croatian scientist Nikola Tesla was one of the foremost contributors to human understanding of electromagnetism, although Titoist propaganda later reinvented him as half-Serb and half-Croat on the basis of selective evidence.
         </span>
        </li>

           Vladimir Huzjan (July 2008).
           <a class="external text" href="http://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&amp;id_clanak_jezik=43829" rel="nofollow">
            "Pokušaj otkrivanja nastanka i razvoja kravate kao riječi i odjevnoga predmeta"
           </a>
           [The origin and development of the tie (kravata) as a word and as a garment].
           <i>
            Povijesni prilozi
           </i>
           (in Croatian). Croatian Institute of History.
           <b>
            34
           </b>
           (34): 103–120.
           <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Serial_Number" title="International Standard Serial Number">
            ISSN
           </a>
           <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0351-9767" rel="nofollow">

           <a class="external text" href="http://hrcak.srce.hr/index.php?show=clanak&amp;id_clanak_jezik=95675" rel="nofollow">

             <tr>
              <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
               <div>
                <div class="plainlist">
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   <sup>
                    1
                   </sup>
                   <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">
                    Oceanic islands
                   </a>
                   within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   <sup>
                    2
                   </sup>
                   Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                </div>
               </div>
              </td>
             </tr>

               <a href="/wiki/List_of_states_with_limited_recognition" title="List of states with limited recognition">

               </a>
              </th>
              <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
               <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
                <ul>
                 <li>

                   Northern Cyprus
                  </a>
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <a href="/wiki/State_of_Palestine" title="State of Palestine">
                   Palestine
                  </a>
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>
              </td>
             </tr>
             <tr>
              <th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">

                Dependencies
               </a>

         <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px;font-size:114%;">
          <div style="padding:0px;">
           <div aria-labelledby="Member_states_of_the_European_Union" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px">
            <table class="nowraplinks collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit">
             <tr>
              <th class="navbox-title" colspan="3" scope="col">
               <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini">
                <ul>
                 <li class="nv-view">
                  <a href="/wiki/Template:Member_states_of_the_European_Union" title="Template:Member states of the European Union">
                   <abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none;" title="View this template">
                    v
                   </abbr>
                  </a>
                 </li>

                  <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Member_states_of_the_European_Union" title="Template talk:Member states of the European Union">
                   <abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none;" title="Discuss this template">
                    t
                   </abbr>
                  </a>
                 </li>
                 <li class="nv-edit">
                  <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Member_states_of_the_European_Union&amp;action=edit">

                    e
                   </abbr>
                  </a>
                 </li>
                </ul>
               </div>

               <div>
                <ol>
                 <li>
                  <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China">
                   Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China
                  </a>
                  , participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Officially the Republic of China, participates as "
                  <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">
                   Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu
                  </a>
                  ", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.
                 </li>

                    </sup>
                   </span>
                   Associate member.
                   <br/>
                   <span style="position: relative; top: 0.2em;">
                    <sup>
                     <small>
                      2
                     </small>
                    </sup>
                   </span>
                   Provisionally referred to by the Francophonie as the "former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia"; see
                   <a href="/wiki/Macedonia_naming_dispute" title="Macedonia naming dispute">
                    Macedonia naming dispute
                   </a>
                   .
                  </div>
                 </td>
                </tr>
               </table>
              </td>
             </tr>
